Max / It’s such a cute little game that I didn’t leave my room for days playing. Max is what I unoriginally named my farmer, so we have the same name. (Abigail is goth bae). Shitpost blog: @the-edgy-unedgy Smash bros blog: @ridley-and-the-ridleys

Joja-oc ask blog: @ask-joja-damicle

Profile Pic was drawn by @honey-beatrix , so go show them some love!

blog.name: today-piplup-says
blog.title: She Has A Lot Of Things To Say!
blog.description: Piplup is a good pokemon! 💙Submissions and art always welcome! 💙If you need something tagged, please do not hesitate to ask! 💙This blog is LGBTQ friendly as the owner is bisexual. 💙Mean homophobic and transphobic comments get deleted and blocked, so save your breath 💙 I track ‘today-piplup-says’ ! 💙¡hablo un poco español!💙 (Run by Cass)

caption:
Regional Variant Bellsprout

Electric Type

title: Flaaffy - 180
body:
Its fleece quality changes to generate strong static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare, slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.

- Pokemon Emerald

title: Dugtrio Haiku

Flowing, golden locks of hair
What are you really?

summary: Aaand apparently Ultra Legends will premiere in Canada on March 2nd, unless the Canadian TVPassport has an error. That’s fast....
body: Aaand apparently Ultra Legends will premiere in Canada on March 2nd, unless the Canadian TVPassport has an error. That’s fast. We’ll hear the new dub song in just 2 weeks :O Wooow I’m so looking forward to seeing what they’ll do now!

blog.name: mossdeepmedium
blog.title: A Blog By An Ex- Gym Leader
blog.description:
My name is Circe and I am the ex leader of the Mossdeep Gym in the Hoenn region, and the aunt of the current Mossdeep gym leaders, Liza and Tate.

I currently work at the Pokémon center with nurse Joy helping rehabilitate sick and injured Pokémon. Any questions you have I am more than willing to answer to the best of my ability

summary: The Goomy line can make a sound akin to a wobbly sound effect, usually indicating that they’re nervous. In the wild the sound...
body: The Goomy line can make a sound akin to a wobbly sound effect, usually indicating that they’re nervous. In the wild the sound can be very disturbing, and also in the middle of the night when you’re just trying to get a glass of water.

reblog.comment: The Goomy line can make a sound akin to a wobbly sound effect, usually indicating that they’re nervous. In the wild the sound can be very disturbing, and also in the middle of the night when you’re just trying to get a glass of water.

summary: Last Saturday the Shadeslayers lost two party members.  Their White Mage, Lilliana, and their Rogue, Zeish.  Unable to revive...
caption:
Last Saturday the Shadeslayers lost two party members.  Their White Mage, Lilliana, and their Rogue, Zeish.  Unable to revive them, the characters are dead permanently.  



From the journal of Jace Ray:  

It’s painfully quiet.

That’s all I can think of. The silence is almost deafening. The only thing keeping my ears from ringing is the soft crackling of the fire as everyone stares on in silence. Adachi approaches my side and appears to start to say something, but can’t seem to find the words. Ari gives me a worried glance from a few feet away. Though I appreciate her concern, I hardly even acknowledge her. Akira stands a farther distance away, just across the room from Sol, also standing. They both appear to be at a loss for words, but I don’t pay either of them any mind. Thalnor, having assisted in starting the fire, simply stares into the pit, his expression impossible to read behind his visor. And just beyond the blaze, I don’t dare look, for I am well aware that the bodies of my friends, Liliana and Zeish, lay on the floor, motionless.  

I reach into my bag, pulling out one of many robes I’d picked up from many, many cultists. Once, I saw it as a chance to lessen our chances of an encounter going south; a chance to blend in if we needed to do so. But since we left that demiplane, I couldn’t regard it as anything other than an item of my mortal enemy.

I’d never thought of anything or anyone as a mortal enemy. Not even Haltman, that corrupt judge who’s wanted my mother and I dead for years and years. Haltman was going to be behind bars soon enough anyways. For all I can tell, the only one fighting these damn things are us and Tovu, most likely taking out her frustrations on plenty of them.

That was the worst part. Not seeing them die, but telling their loved ones they’d died.

It was Zeish’s mom first. She had simply contacted to tell us that the dig site we were originally going to investigate had been compromised. Once upon a time, I’d have been upset at the lost chance to investigate something I could combine with my current technical knowledge. But when I received that message, that digsite was the last thing on my mind. I’d informed her that the party was far away enough to be safe, but that her daughter had died at the hands of a very powerful void mage. There was no response, which I had expected. Making use of the Sending Stone that I had received from Akira, who’d given me the items, I asked if we should bring Zeish’s body back to Dawnbreak Town.

The answer was simple. “Yes.”

Tovu, the Togedemaru cleric that had once been a part of our team, contacted me next, sounding as though in distress. She expressed that her mental link with Zeish had snapped, and Liliana wouldn’t respond to Sending spells.

I began to bawl as I prepared to respond. I informed her that both Zeish and Liliana has died, and that we had no method of reviving either of them.

There was no response.

Moments later, Ari requested that the remaining party members gather around Liliana’s body. Without explanation, she casted a spell; and once again, we all heard the Audino’s voice. I must have been shaken, but I hung on to every word she said. And, as suddenly as she had spoken, after five questions, she fell silent again.

I look down at the robe still in my paws. I feel enraged, infuriated. Two of our friends had just died. Even if I’d avenged both of them, it didn’t feel like enough.

I begin to tear at the robe, shredding it into pieces. No one says a word. Sol even tosses me a few extras he’d been hanging onto, and the Dewott and Spinda that had earlier been under mind control lended me their robes to destroy, too.

Once I’d shredded each and every cultist robe to thousands of tiny pieces, I fed each bit of fabric to the fire, staring as each piece is consumed by the blaze.

My momentary aggression vanishes soon after. I began to tear up again, but did my best to fight it. I had to be strong. For Zeish, who was one of my only friends back when it was just Adachi, her, and I. For Liliana, who was the mother figure that Julia wasn’t allowed to be.

I look to the fire, and feel something deep within me shift.

I’m gonna make every one of those damn cultists pay for what they did.

-Jace Ray
Artificer

Haltman was going to be behind bars soon enough anyways. For all I can tell, the only one fighting these damn things are us and Tovu, most likely taking out her frustrations on plenty of them.

That was the worst part. Not seeing them die, but telling their loved ones they’d died.

It was Zeish’s mom first. She had simply contacted to tell us that the dig site we were originally going to investigate had been compromised. Once upon a time, I’d have been upset at the lost chance to investigate something I could combine with my current technical knowledge. But when I received that message, that digsite was the last thing on my mind. I’d informed her that the party was far away enough to be safe, but that her daughter had died at the hands of a very powerful void mage. There was no response, which I had expected. Making use of the Sending Stone that I had received from Akira, who’d given me the items, I asked if we should bring Zeish’s body back to Dawnbreak Town.

The answer was simple. “Yes.”

Tovu, the Togedemaru cleric that had once been a part of our team, contacted me next, sounding as though in distress. She expressed that her mental link with Zeish had snapped, and Liliana wouldn’t respond to Sending spells.

I began to bawl as I prepared to respond. I informed her that both Zeish and Liliana has died, and that we had no method of reviving either of them.

There was no response.

Moments later, Ari requested that the remaining party members gather around Liliana’s body. Without explanation, she casted a spell; and once again, we all heard the Audino’s voice. I must have been shaken, but I hung on to every word she said. And, as suddenly as she had spoken, after five questions, she fell silent again.

I look down at the robe still in my paws. I feel enraged, infuriated. Two of our friends had just died. Even if I’d avenged both of them, it didn’t feel like enough.

I begin to tear at the robe, shredding it into pieces. No one says a word. Sol even tosses me a few extras he’d been hanging onto, and the Dewott and Spinda that had earlier been under mind control lended me their robes to destroy, too.

Once I’d shredded each and every cultist robe to thousands of tiny pieces, I fed each bit of fabric to the fire, staring as each piece is consumed by the blaze.

My momentary aggression vanishes soon after. I began to tear up again, but did my best to fight it. I had to be strong. For Zeish, who was one of my only friends back when it was just Adachi, her, and I. For Liliana, who was the mother figure that Julia wasn’t allowed to be.

I look to the fire, and feel something deep within me shift.

I’m gonna make every one of those damn cultists pay for what they did.

-Jace Ray
Artificer
trail.content_abstract: Last Saturday the Shadeslayers lost two party members.  Their White Mage, Lilliana, and their Rogue, Zeish.  Unable to revive them, the characters are dead permanently.
